subject: Creativity
title: Why Minor Keys Sound Sad: Music and Emotion
description: Learn Why Minor Keys Sound Sad: Music and Emotion in one minute.

hook.text: Play a major chord: happy. Play a minor chord: sad. But WHY?

buildup.text: Western listeners consistently link major keys with happiness and minor keys with sadness.

discovery.text: One theory: minor intervals mimic the acoustic properties of sad speech â€” lower pitch, less energy, descending contours.

twist.text: In some cultures, minor keys sound mysterious or beautiful, not sad.

climax.text: Film composers exploit this ruthlessly. John Williams shifts between major and minor to manipulate your emotions frame.

punchline.text: Music doesn't contain emotions. It triggers them. The brain does the rest.

quiz.question: Is the sad quality of minor keys universal across all cultures?
options: No, some cultures hear minor keys as mysterious or beautiful
